content.description:
Try Your Luck is another phenomenal line that proves CCC is far from climbed out.

Start squatting on the far left arete or the Eyewitness Boulder (left hand jug horn and right hand jug in the crack 2’ off the ground). Move up and right over a built landing through perfect edges and good feet which lead to a poor and sharp right pinch and a super small, left, razor blade. Find some finicky feet to make a giant toss to a right hand jug (terrifying and hard), then top out as for

Flashbulb Infinity

.

Try Your Luck breaks down into a V7/8 to the jump, then a 1 move V7/8 to the jug, the jump being potentially disastrous in the event of a bad fall. From the jug, the climbing is V3 and super exposed, and falling would be catastrophic, as the hillside is quite steep and exposed.
content.protection: At least 4 pads and a spot. The crux move is really scary and potentially dangerous.
content.location:
This is on the first boulder when arriving at The Crow’s Nest.

Eyewitness to Power

climbs the right arete,

Flashbulb Infinity

climbs the face from a right jug system, and Try Your Luck blasts right up the middle of the face from the left.

content.description: This is a jug haul on the main face of the boulder. Head up the obvious jugs, and mantel the scary lip. It is classic... if you like highballs with sketchy landings.
content.location: This problem is on the first boulder you arrive after hiking up. It is the middle line up the east face.

content.description: Eyewitness to Power is a classic arete climb with some unique movement and just enough height to keep you focused. It has really beautiful rock and interesting holds.
content.location: Start on the left side of the boulder, and make your way to the arete and on to the right side for the topout.

content.description:
Death by Lion is another fun moderate.

Start squatting on with a left hand, slopey hold around the arete and a right hand, bad, 3 finger crimp. Make a few powerful and fun slaps to jugs halfway up the arete. Turn the corner, and follow the dihedral (take care here) to the top.
content.protection: A few pads will protect the difficulties. The top (V1) is dangerous but manageable.
content.location:
Just left of

Death by Crow

, start down in the hole, and climb the surprisingly fun arete.

content.description:
Death by Crow is a nice warm-up for the fingers and the mind.

Start sitting in the cave on a sharp right hand undercling/sidepull, and a left hand edge 2’ to the left. Work up through jugs and edges to a long move out left; grabbing a flat square edge and holding a swing out over the abyss. Finish in the corner as for

Death by Lion

.
content.protection: A few pads. Once on the arete, you shouldn’t fall, and it’s not a good idea either.
content.location: It is in between Eyewitness Boulder and Cost Of Dreaming Wall in a small cave with nice rock. Climb left to the high arete, then turn the corner.

content.description: This problem is on one of the best boulders I have ever climbed. It is scary but can be safe with clever pad placement. Start on the lowest good holds you can grab on the left side of the face, then climb to the arete, and blast straight up the improbable line.
content.protection: Pads. I used a TR to figure it out and not break my legs.
content.location: It is hidden just west of the first boulder you arrive at. Walk up a small gully, and then look down into the slash in the rock. A couple more lines exist here for those that can climb double digit boulders.
